trial_identification.studytitle: Safety/Tolerability/Pharmacokinetic (PK)/Pharmacodynamics (PD) Study of BMN701 in Patients With Late-Onset Pompe Disease
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Phase 1/2 Open-label Study of the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamic and Preliminary Efficacy of BMN 701 (GILT-tagged Recombinant Human GAA) in Patients With Late-onset Pompe Disease

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other human genetics and inherited disorders

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - BMN 701
Experimental: BMN 701 - IV infusion
Other interventions: BMN 701 GILT-tagged recombinant human GAA

primaryOutcome.outcome: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Mean distance walked as measured by the Six-minute Walk Test (6MWT)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A Phase 1/2, open-label, multicenter, multiple dose escalation study of BMN 701 administered by intravenous infusion every 2 weeks over a 24-week treatment period to patients with late-onset Pompe disease.
